<div align="center">

### Constellation Business Intelligence Platform

Transform your business data into actionable insights with powerful analytics and visualization capabilities

Built on Lightdash - connect your dbt project → add business metrics → analyze and visualize with your team

</div>

## About This Project

This is the **Constellation Business Intelligence Platform** built on top of [Lightdash](https://www.lightdash.com), the open-source Looker alternative. It provides a powerful platform for all business intelligence projects at Constellation, including:

- 📊 **Business Analytics**: Analyze key business metrics, trends, and performance indicators
- 🧮 **Advanced Calculations**: Create custom business formulas and calculations
- 📈 **Data Visualization**: Build interactive dashboards for business insights
- 🔍 **Self-Service Analytics**: Enable teams to explore business data independently
- 📋 **Reporting**: Generate automated business reports and insights

## Key Features

- [x] 📊 **Business Metrics**: Pre-built metrics for various business domains and calculations
- [x] 🧮 **Custom Calculations**: Create complex business formulas and table calculations
- [x] 📈 **Interactive Dashboards**: Build and share business dashboards with your team
- [x] 🔍 **Data Exploration**: Drill down into business data with powerful filtering and segmentation
- [x] 📊 **Visualization Library**: Comprehensive charts and graphs for business analytics
- [x] 🔄 **Version Control**: Track changes to business calculations and rollback when needed
- [x] 📤 **Export & Sharing**: Share business insights via URL or scheduled reports
- [x] 🔐 **Access Control**: Manage user permissions for sensitive business data

## Quick Start

### Prerequisites

- A dbt project with business data models
- Docker (for local development)
- AWS account (for production deployment)

### Local Development

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone <your-repo-url>
   cd const-lightdash-app
   ```

2. **Install dependencies**
   ```bash
   ./scripts/install.sh
   ```

3. **Configure environment**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   # Edit .env with your database and dbt configuration
   ```

4. **Start the application**
   ```bash
   docker-compose up
   ```

### Production Deployment

This project is configured for AWS ECS deployment. The deployment workflow automatically:

- Builds Docker images
- Pushes to Amazon ECR
- Deploys to ECS cluster

See `.github/workflows/.deploy.yml` for deployment configuration.

## Project Structure

```
const-lightdash-app/
├── packages/
│   ├── backend/          # Lightdash backend services
│   ├── frontend/         # React frontend application
│   ├── common/           # Shared utilities and types
│   └── warehouses/       # Database adapters
├── docker/              # Docker configuration
├── scripts/             # Build and deployment scripts
└── examples/            # Example dbt models and configurations
```

## Configuration

### Environment Variables

Key configuration options in `.env`:

```bash
# Database connection
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://...

# dbt project configuration
DBT_PROJECT_DIR=../const-dbt-project
LIGHTDASH_DBT_PROFILE=const_business_intelligence

# AWS deployment
AWS_REGION=us-east-1
ECR_REPOSITORY=const-lightdash
```

### dbt Integration

This project expects a dbt project with business data models. Configure your dbt project to include:

- Business metrics and KPIs
- Revenue and financial data
- Customer and user analytics
- Custom business dimensions

## Development

### Adding Business Intelligence Features

1. **Custom Metrics**: Add business-specific metrics in your dbt models
2. **Calculations**: Create table calculations for complex business formulas
3. **Dashboards**: Build business dashboards using the Lightdash interface
4. **Custom Dimensions**: Define business-specific dimensions and filters

### Contributing

This project follows the same contribution guidelines as Lightdash. See the [Lightdash contributing guide](https://github.com/lightdash/lightdash/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.

- **Documentation**: [Lightdash Docs](http://docs.lightdash.com/)
